alert.note: Alert for Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 11:43PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following county, Buckingham. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring as a result of excessive rainfall during the past several days. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1132 PM EDT, The Slate River at Arvonia VA remains in minor flood. At 1115 PM EDT this evening, the river is currently cresting around 12.6 feet and should begin to fall over the next several hours. However, it will remain in flood for at least the next 2-3 hours. This flooding is the result of runoff from prior heavy rainfall and completely saturated soils during the past several days. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Slate River, Sharps Creek, Rocky Creek, Muddy Creek, Crooked Creek and James River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Buckingham County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
